meanings.definition: Capable of being easily expanded or upgraded
meanings.sent1: The software company developed a scalable platform that could grow with the business.
meanings.sent2: The website was designed to be scalable, allowing for more users without slowing down.
meanings.sent3: The scalable garden hose magically extended to reach the entire yard.
meanings.sent4: Her scalable ambition knew no bounds, always reaching for higher goals.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a scalable business model became crystal clear after the successful launch.

meanings.definition: Able to be adjusted in size or scale
meanings.sent1: The scalable font feature on the computer allowed users to change text size easily.
meanings.sent2: The scalable map could be zoomed in or out for better navigation.
meanings.sent3: The chef's scalable recipe made it simple to cook for a small or large group.
meanings.sent4: His scalable approach to problem-solving meant he could adapt to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The scalable building blocks let children create structures of all sizes.

meanings.definition: Designed to accommodate growth or increase in size
meanings.sent1: The scalable storage solution expanded to hold more files as needed.
meanings.sent2: The scalable business model allowed for easy expansion into new markets.
meanings.sent3: The scalable backpack magically fit all her belongings no matter how much she added.
meanings.sent4: Her scalable wardrobe was ready for any weight fluctuations.
meanings.sent5: The scalable plan for the event ensured smooth operations even with unexpected guests.
